headline: GM seeks to rehire former Cruise staff in new autonomous car push
summary: Investing.com -- General Motors Co (NYSE:GM). is looking to bring back some former employees from its discontinued Cruise autonomous-vehicle unit as part of a new initiative to develop driverless cars, according to a Bloomberg report on Monday.

raw.headline: GM seeks to rehire former Cruise staff in new autonomous car push

headline: Michigan Lawmaker Slams GM for Importing EV Batteries From China
summary: General Motors is catching flak in its own backyard for its decision to import batteries from China for its most affordable electric vehicle, the forthcoming second-generation Chevrolet Bolt.  Rep. John Moolenaar (R., Mich.) slammed the Detroit automaker for doing business with Chinese battery maker CATL, which he called “a Chinese military company that is building batteries for China’s submarines.”

raw.headline: Michigan Lawmaker Slams GM for Importing EV Batteries From China

headline: Fed to cut rates next month as tariffs give prices one-time spur: survey
summary: A handful of Fed officials have voiced optimism since July that the highest U.S. tariffs since the 1930s will stoke just short-term price pressures.

raw.headline: Fed to cut rates next month as tariffs give prices one-time spur: survey
raw.summary: A handful of Fed officials have voiced optimism since July that the highest U.S. tariffs since the 1930s will stoke just short-term price pressures.

headline: Americans are Shouldering Most of Trump's Import Taxes
summary: U.S. businesses from Nike to General Motors have so far borne the brunt of costs from President Trump's taxes on imported goods, masking their impact on the economy.  Wall Street believes it will soon be consumers' time in the barrel.  While foreign companies that ship goods stateside have reduced prices somewhat in response to Trump's tariffs, they shouldered just 14% of total costs through June, according to Goldman Sachs.

raw.headline: Americans are Shouldering Most of Trump's Import Taxes

headline: 3 Industrials Stocks Walking a Fine Line
summary: Even if they go mostly unnoticed, industrial businesses are the backbone of our country. But their prominence also brings high exposure to the ups and downs of economic cycles. Luckily, their overall demand was steady over the past six months as the industry’s 4.5% return has closely followed the S&P 500.
